intro: Erica spumosa, commonly known as the foamy heath, is a flowering plant native to the western Cape of South Africa. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces white or pale pink blooms that appear in spring, adding a delicate touch to its natural habitat. Erica spumosa thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
